senses.synonym: e-mail: (computer science) a system of world-wide electronic communication in which a computer user can compose a message at one terminal that can be regenerated at the recipient's terminal when the recipient logs in; 'you cannot send packages by electronic mail' <i69508>

relations.target: network=03825135-n (an open fabric of string or rope or wire woven together at regular intervals);03826014-n ((broadcasting) a communication system consisting of a group of broadcasting stations that all transmit the same programs; \""the networks compete to broadcast important sports events\"");03826268-n ((electronics) a system of interconnected electronic components or circuits);03826490-n (a system of intersecting lines or channels; \""a railroad network\""; \""a network of canals\"");08451269-n (an interconnected system of things or people; \""he owned a network of shops\""; \""retirement meant dropping out of a whole network of people who had been part of my life\""; \""tangled in a web of cloth\"");01034712-v (communicate with and within a group; \""You have to network if you want to get a good job\""
computer=03086983-n (a machine for performing calculations automatically);09906486-n (an expert at calculation (or at operating calculating machines))

senses.definition: A system for transferring messages from one computer to another, usually via a network
